channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jerome Powell sends point-by-point response to White House about Fed office renovations
item.description: And addresses speculation about VIP dining rooms and elevators, marble facades and water fountains.

item.title: Penny Pennington of investment advice firm Edward Jones: ‘We’re a health and wellbeing company’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Before Trump, Indonesia Had Another Trade Headache: China
item.description: Long before President Trump wielded tariffs as a weapon to punish Indonesia, the country was fighting back a flood of cheap Chinese goods.

item.title: UK, France and Germany Plan for a Post-U.S. Future
item.description: The leaders of France, Germany and Britain are building parallel diplomatic institutions to defend Europe as President Trump retreats from the contine...

item.title: Malaysia’s AI darling NationGate sees shares tumble after it got raided in a scrap metal smuggling probe
item.description: Shares in Nationgate, the fastest-growing company on Fortune's Southeast Asia 500, are down over 10% since Tuesday.

item.title: An elite new JP Morgan unit is driving deals for sports teams and stadiums—and bringing in billions
item.description: The bank has found a lucrative new niche in sports investment banking

item.title: Airbnb’s CEO studied Steve Jobs’s playbook to slash bureaucracy and build his $84 billion empire. Inside Brian Chesky’s 5-step hiring strategy to cut red tape
item.description: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky believes “founder mode” is still an essential strategy for corporate survival.

item.title: Floods and Heavy Rain Kill Dozens in Pakistan
item.description: Relentless rain began on Wednesday, causing flooding in several cities and across vast rural stretches in the province of Punjab.

item.title: Who Are the Druse: The Religious Minority at the Center of Israel and Syria’s Tensions
